HOUSE BILL No. 1464
_____
DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
Citations Affected:  IC 12-15-5-16.5.
Synopsis:  Language interpretation in health care settings. Requires the
office of the secretary of family and social services to, subject to
federal approval, provide Medicaid reimbursement for certified
medical interpretation services for Medicaid recipients who have
limited English proficiency when receiving Medicaid covered services
from a Medicaid provider. Requires the establishment of a community
advisory committee.
Effective:  July 1, 2025.
Summers
January 21, 2025, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Public Health.

HOUSE BILL No. 1464
A BILL FOR AN ACT to amend the Indiana Code concerning
human services.
Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Indiana:
1 SECTION 1. IC 12-15-5-16.5 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
2 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
3 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 16.5. (a) Subject to the approval
4 under subsection (d), the office of the secretary shall reimburse for
5 the provision of certified medical interpretation services for
6 Medicaid recipients who have limited English proficiency when
7 receiving Medicaid covered services from a Medicaid provider.
8 (b) The office of the secretary shall ensure that any contract for
9 the provision of certified medical interpretation services allows a
10 Medicaid provider to access scheduling for the service.
11 (c) The office of the secretary shall establish a community
12 advisory committee to advise on the provision of certified medical
13 interpretation servi ces. The advisory committee must consist of
14 stakeholders and Medicaid health care providers.
15 (d) The office of the secretary shall apply to the United States
16 Department of Health and Human Services for any state plan
17 amendment or waiver necessary to implement this section.
